Police sergeant dead after allegedly shooting officer

A Hamilton police sergeant was found dead last night, hours after he allegedly shot and seriously injured a Beverly police officer, officials said. (Globe)
  • H-W Chronicle Hamilton officer promoted last summer

Two US advisers killed in Afghan ministry

A gunman killed two Americans inside a government compound in Kabul today, officials said, as protests against the Koran burnings rage on. (AP, 11:09 a.m.)
  • Pakistan calls on Taliban to enter Afghan peace talks

Housing is taking bigger bite of income

Nearly a quarter of working households in Mass. and across the US spend more than half their income on housing, according to a study. (Boston Globe)

Debate at BU extends to safety

What began with sexual assault charges against two Boston University hockey players has mushroomed into a broader debate about women’s safety. (Boston Globe)
  • 2/24/12: BU to investigate school’s hockey culture

2 Upper Crust franchises shut down

The franchisee who had to pay more than $80,000 in back wages for violating overtime and record-keeping laws has closed restaurants in Salem and Beverly. (Globe)
  • 12/21/10 AG probes Upper Crust | 12/5/10 A chain's start
